result.execSummary:
The defendant Jennifer M Polak was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jennifer M Polak is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jennifer M Polak was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Incident], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine of $500.00 including all applicable costs and surcharges.  To be paid by 8/7/15.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jennifer M Polak

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jennifer M Polak in court with attorney Gilbert Fielding Urfer.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
  Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Court ordered the defendant to pay a fine of $500.00  including all applicable costs and surcharges to be paid iby 8/07/15.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.   rmm

As to Coun1: Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered charge dismissed.  As to Count 2 as amended, Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 40.

Defendant Jennifer M Polak in court with attorney Gilbert Fielding Urfer.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   As to Count 2: Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of State, Court ordered pentalty enhancer, Use of a Dangerous Weapon, dismissed.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 8, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Jennifer M Polak in court with attorney Gilbert Fielding Urfer.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Pretrial Conference held.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 30, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  rmm

Defendant Jennifer M Polak in court with attorney Gilbert Fielding Urfer.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Case transferred to Branch 40 due to the assignement of ADA Michael Schindhelm.   Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Discovery received by defense counsel.  Case adjourned for Pretrial Conference in Branch 40 on 4-9-2015 at 1:30 pm.  All conditions of bail are continued, including the no contact order with Jenna K., contact with James P., is only permitted for the exchange of the minor children at the South Milwaukee Police Station, no possession of dangerous weapons or firearms, cooperate with Justice Point Supervision and no violations of the law, until further order of the Court.   mld
from Justice Point, received and filed.   mld
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.    No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: Jenna K.;  Only contact with James P. permitted for exchange of minor children, to be done at South Milwaukee Police Station.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Jennifer M Polak in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  
Defendant Jennifer M Polak in custody.  
Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 4.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing. '
Defendant pleads Not Guilty as the Misdemeanor Count. 
Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  
IF RELEASED DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.     
Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch 4.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 19, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
